{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3548429,"name":"Guilherme Samuel","username":"megarubber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/megarubber/{size}/172063_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T18:10:45.460Z","cooked":"

I am using py -3 -m robotpy test and it looks weired at time of execution, because it never finishes. If I run py -3 -m robotpy deploy without execute any test, it works without problems. I tried the isolated mode, but it still not working for me. How could I solve this issue?

Is there a stack trace when you ctrl-c it? That could tell you where it’s hanging. You might need to specify --full-trace to see them.

On linux there’s a SIGUSR2 handler that will print out the current thread stack traces immediately, but there isn’t an equivalent on windows.

Yeah, that’s not very useful.

If you don’t run in isolated mode, it should be a more useful output? If you send me a link to your code I can give it a shot too.

virtuald:

If you don’t run in isolated mode, it should be a more useful output?

No, it doesn’t. Unfortunately, it’s pretty much the same output shown before. I run py -3 -m robotpy test -- --full-trace for this test.

The code is here: GitHub - TaubatexasRobotics/2025-season-robot-code at feat/photonvision

Probably is a issue on my computer when it runs the Python process, because I tested in other machine and they work as expected. But I don’t know which thing is hanging the pytest execution.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T04:44:21.744Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":18,"readers_count":17,"score":8.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494371,"topic_slug":"tests-are-not-running-in-robotpy","display_username":"Guilherme Samuel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/TaubatexasRobotics/2025-season-robot-code/tree/feat/photonvision","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - TaubatexasRobotics/2025-season-robot-code at feat/photonvision","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47943,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/tests-are-not-running-in-robotpy/494371/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3550187,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T04:27:29.430Z","cooked":"

I note that you have rev as a dependency. Since you mentioned that other computers worked, there was a hanging bug in the initial versions of the revlib library this year. Likely the computer that is failing has an older version installed.

Add the following to your pyproject.toml and run robotpy sync:

requires = [
    "robotpy-rev~=2025.0.2",
]

Wow, this is what I needed. I’ll pay more attention when using pyproject.toml.
